inlineContent.text: Integrate PDFView into your app and configure various display options
to provide an optimal PDF reading experience.
Add PDFView to a ViewController.
Set constraints to fill the entire screen.
Configure the basic properties of PDFView.
Set autoScales, displayMode, displayDirection, and more.
Customize the appearance with backgroundColor and pageShadowsEnabled.
Use system colors for dark mode support.
PDFView is a subclass of UIView
that can be used directly in UIKit apps.
Place it using Auto Layout or frame-based layout,
and assign a PDFDocument to the document property to display it immediately.
Implement UIViewRepresentable to
use PDFView in SwiftUI.
Use @Binding to synchronize with SwiftUI state.
Bind the current page number bidirectionally.
Implement PDFViewDelegate with a Coordinator.
Handle events like page changes, scale changes, and more.
To use PDFView in SwiftUI,
you need to wrap it with UIViewRepresentable.
You can also handle PDFView delegate events using the Coordinator pattern.
Set the displayMode to determine page layout.
singlePage is suitable for book reading apps, continuous for document viewers.
Set the scroll direction with displayDirection.
Choose vertical (default) or horizontal.
Enable autoScales to automatically zoom to fit the view size.
Limit the range with minScaleFactor and maxScaleFactor.
PDFView supports various display modes.
singlePage
: Display one page at a time
singlePageContinuous
: Continuous vertical scrolling
twoUp
: Display two pages side by side
twoUpContinuous
: Continuous scrolling with two pages
Use enableDataDetectors to automatically detect
phone numbers, URLs, etc. and make them tappable.
Add gestures for interaction customization.
Double tap to zoom in/out, long press to show menu, etc.
PDFView supports various user interactions including
pinch zoom, text selection, link clicking, and more.
Each feature can be enabled/disabled individually.
By implementing UIViewRepresentable,
you can use UIKit views in SwiftUI.
UIViewRepresentable
View
The View protocol is used for SwiftUI native views.
A different protocol is needed for wrapping UIKit views.
ObservableObject
ObservableObject is used for data models
and is not related to view wrapping.

Which displayMode should you use to display two pages side by side
with continuous scrolling?
twoUp
twoUp displays two pages side by side
but does not support continuous scrolling.
twoUpContinuous displays two pages side by side
with continuous scrolling capability.

singlePageContinuous
singlePageContinuous displays one page at a time
with continuous scrolling.

automatically detects phone numbers, URLs, etc.
